DataframeConcat.KitText: #> DataframeConcat df2021_FinalDf df2020_FinalDf --exampleTitle Concatenate Two Dataframes Vertically --example When working with data from different time periods or sources, it is common to combine them into a single dataframe. This example concatenates two dataframes by stacking their rows on top of each other. The result is a new dataframe that contains all rows from both inputs, preserving the order and resetting the index to maintain consistency.
DataframeConcat.ExampleDescription: When working with data from different time periods or sources, it is common to combine them into a single dataframe. This example concatenates two dataframes by stacking their rows on top of each other. The result is a new dataframe that contains all rows from both inputs, preserving the order and resetting the index to maintain consistency.
